title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots may target Jaguars' Brian Thomas Jr., who had over 1,200 yards in his first season, in a trade.
New England's offense seeks improvements to aid QB Drake Maye, who faced O-line issues and lack of dynamic weapons.
Thomas could be available after a decline in 2025; potential trade may involve Patriots giving up a first-round pick.

title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Quinn Hughes scored in overtime, leading Team USA to a 2-1 win over Sweden in the 2026 Winter Olympics quarterfinal.
Charlie McAvoy, playing without a face shield, delivered strong defensive performance for Team USA, logging 19:22 minutes on ice.
Four Boston Bruins players remain in Olympic medal contention, including McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman for Team USA and two Finnish players.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries in Pittsfield secured $5.2 million in ICE contracts, the largest in Massachusetts for militarized vehicles.
Governor Maura Healey disapproves of Massachusetts companies contracting with ICE, citing legal concerns over ICE operations.
Lenco received state grants for production expansion, despite turning down a $10 million ICE contract amid other contracts with defense agencies.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dana Pullman and Anne Lynch were sentenced for racketeering, fraud, and tax crimes, receiving 2 years and 15 months in prison.
Pullman misused the Massachusetts State Police union's funds for personal expenses and received a $20,000 kickback.
The U.S. First Circuit Court reversed some convictions in 2025, but other fraud and obstruction convictions remain intact.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz is departing as Boston 25 News chief meteorologist after nearly 30 years at the station.
Lemanowicz will step down from his role on February 27, concluding his tenure that began in 1996.
He covered significant weather events including the 2011 tornadoes, 2015 snowstorms, and 2023 Leominster flooding.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox fans criticized the team's 2026 home jerseys for overlapping lettering and red striping.
Boston Red Sox issued a statement, confirming jersey adjustments with MLB and Fanatics for better design.
Updated jerseys for the 2026 season will be ready by the April 3 home opener against the Padres.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Police seized firearms and ammunition from Robert Dorgan's storage unit and apartment in connection with an ice rink shooting.
Bystanders Michael Black, Robert Rattenni, and Ryan Cordeiro subdued the shooter, preventing further injuries.
Three surviving victims remain in critical condition; police praised citizens' bravery and committed to ongoing investigation.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA to suspend Orange Line and four Commuter Rail lines on weekends from February 21 to March 29 for upgrades.
Shuttle buses will replace Orange Line service from Back Bay to Forest Hills, with passengers advised to add 20 minutes to trips.
Commuter Rail suspensions affect Fitchburg, Haverhill, Lowell, Newburyport/Rockport lines; shuttle services available with varied extra travel times.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers was traded from the Red Sox to the Giants in June 2025 amid positional disputes.
Red Sox chairman Tom Werner criticized Devers for refusing to play first base after a teammate's injury.
Devers, now with the Giants, expressed no interest in revisiting the comments, saying, 'let's leave the past in the past.'

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Adam Schefter reports Maxx Crosby trade would require a Micah Parsons-type package for Raiders to consider.
Crosby is unhappy with Raiders due to communication issues and may seek a trade despite Raiders' reluctance.
Patriots, needing pass rush improvement, could trade their 2026 first-round pick for Crosby if relations with Raiders worsen.
